intro: Barleria punctata, commonly known as the spotted barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has narrow, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Barleria punctata is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
